Account.description: The supplier to which the payment has to be done.

AccountBankAccountID.description: The bank account of the supplier, to which the payment has to be done.

AccountBankAccountNumber.description: The bank account number of the supplier, to which the payment has to be done.

AccountCode.description: The code of the supplier to which the payment has to be done.

AccountContact.description: Contact person copied from the purchase invoice linked to the related purchase entry. Used as prefered contact when sending reminders.

AccountContactName.description: Name of the contact person of the supplier.

AmountDC.description: The amount in default currency (division currency). Payments are matched on this amount.

AmountDiscountDC.description: The amount of the discount in the default currency.

AmountDiscountFC.description: The amount of the discount. This is in the amount of the selected currency.

AmountFC.description: The amount of the payment. This is in the amount of the selected currency.

ApprovalStatus.description: Shows the approval status of the payment. Values can be 1 N/A, 2 Awaiting review, 3 Awaiting approval, 4 Approved, 5 Rejected. Approval of payments is not enabled in all subscriptions. If turned of the ApprovalStatus is null

BankAccountID.description: Own bank account from which the payment must be done.

BankAccountNumber.description: Own bank account number from which the payment must be done.

CashflowTransactionBatchCode.description: When processing payments, all payments with the same processing data are put in a batch. This field contains the code of that batch.

Currency.description: The currency of the payment. This currency can only deviate from the division currency if the module Currency is in the license.

Description.description: Extra description for the payment that may be included in the bank export file.

DirectDebitMandate.description: Direct Debit Mandate used to collect the PaymentTerms.

DirectDebitMandatePaymentType.description: Payment type of the mandate.  0 = One off payment  1 = Recurrent payment.

DirectDebitMandateType.description: Type of the mandate.  0 = Core  1 = Business-to-business.

DiscountDueDate.description: Date before which the payment must be done to be eligible for discount.

Document.description: Document that is created when processing payments. The bank export file is attached to the document.

DueDate.description: Date before which the payment must be done.

EndDate.description: Date since when the payment is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest invoice date of all matched payments.

EndPeriod.description: Period since when the payment is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest period of all matched payments.

EndToEndID.description: The value of the tag 'EndToEndID' when generating a SEPA file.

EndYear.description: Year (of period) since when the payment is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest year of all matched payments. Used in combination with EndPeriod.

EntryID.description: The unique identifier for a set of payments. A payment can be split so that one part is paid on a different date. In that case the two records get a different EntryID.

EntryNumber.description: Entry number of the linked transaction.

GLAccount.description: G/L account of the payment. Must be of type 22 (Accounts payable).

InvoiceDate.description: Invoice date of the linked transaction.

InvoiceNumber.description: Invoice number of the linked transaction.

IsBatchBooking.description: Boolean indicating whether the payment is part of a batch booking.

IsFullyPaid.description: Boolean indicating whether the receivable was fully paid by the customer.

LineType.description: Determines if the record is a payment or receipt. In case of payment the value is 22, in case of receipt the value is 20

OrderNumber.description: Order number of the linked transaction.

PaymentBatchNumber.description: Number assigned during the of processing payments. When payments are processed a bank export file is created. This file contains one or more batches that contain one or more payments. Each batch gets a sequence number that is stored for each payment in that batch.

PaymentCondition.description: Payment condition of the linked transaction.

PaymentDays.description: Number of days between invoice date and due date.

PaymentDaysDiscount.description: Number of days between invoice date and due date of the discount.

PaymentInformationID.description: PaymentInformationID tag from the SEPA xml file.

PaymentMethod.description: Method of payment.  B = On credit (default)  I = Collection  K = Cash  V = Credit card.

PaymentReference.description: Payment reference for the payment that may be included in the bank export file.

PaymentSelected.description: Date and time since when the payment is selected to be paid.

PaymentSelector.description: User who selected the payment to be paid.

RateFC.description: Exchange rate from payment currency to division currency. AmountFC * RateFC = AmountDC.

ReceivableBatchNumber.description: Number assigned during the processing of receivables.

ReceivableSelected.description: Date and time since when the receivable is selected to be collected.

ReceivableSelector.description: User who selected the receivable to be collected.

Status.description: The status of the payment.  20 = open  30 = selected - payment is selected to be paid  40 = processed - payment has been done  50 = matched - payment is matched with one or more other outstanding items or financial statement lines

TransactionAmountDC.description: Total amount of the linked transaction in default currency (division currency).

TransactionAmountFC.description: Total amount of the linked transaction in the selected currency.

TransactionDueDate.description: Due date of the linked transaction.

TransactionEntryID.description: Linked transaction. Use this as reference to PurchaseEntries.

TransactionID.description: Linked transaction line. Use this as reference to PurchaseEntryLines.

TransactionIsReversal.description: Indicates if the linked transaction is a reversal entry.

YourRef.description: Invoice number of the supplier. In case the payment belongs to a bank entry line and is matched with one invoice, YourRef is filled with the YourRef of this invoice.
